If you have the private keys of the both the server and the person connecting to SSH, you can decrypt it with some work

how can i connect to this port?

For example, if you have SSH listening on port 2345 (you should never have it listening on the default port if its connect to the internet) you could try "ssh -p 2345 6.7.8.9" where 6.7.8.9 is the IP address reported by wimi.com
i have ssh on 22 port and nothing on that port which i want to check

but i figured out that thing: I have my app which is client of a simple game, so i put there my internet IP and this port and tried to connect, and i opened tcpdump -nnv... on server and nothing appered. is that mean that there is no port open there or what?
The client would have complained about not being able to connect. If you don't get anything from tcpdump, then that means the port is either closed or just not mapped to your server

If you are just trying to test a service like SSH, just use the SSH command. If you are checking a port you plan to use later, use nc to start listening on the port and then use another nc to connect to it and see if you can transfer text between the two nc's
